intro: Herschelia spathulata subsp. tripartita, commonly known as the three-lobed broomrape, is a parasitic plant belonging to the Orobanchaceae family. It lacks chlorophyll and relies entirely on its host for nutrients, typically growing on the roots of various grasses and shrubs.
